intro: Papaver virgatum, commonly known as the common poppy, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a smooth, slender stem and broad, lobed leaves that are typically green and hairy. Its flowers contain a capsule that splits open to release numerous seeds. Papaver virgatum is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
